Posts.Content: Thank you
Posts.Title: First Radiotherapy meeting

Posts.Content: thank-you
Posts.Title: First Radiotherapy meeting

Posts.Content: Hi everyone. I have just finished by 4 "ec" and due to start taxol on the 1st August for 12 weeks. My radiotherapy starts in November and i havent thought about it as it seemed so far away but i've now been told i have my first radiotherapy appointment on Monday 24th July. What questions should i ask? I am HER2+ive. I had a mastectomy on the 10th April. 14 nodes removed, 5 infected, one of which was "extra capsular extension" Thanks Deirdre
Posts.Title: First Radiotherapy meeting

Posts.Content: Hi all. I read an article on Friday 16th June 2017 in a british newspaper that said the new drug 'KADCYLA ' has been passed for patients with HER2 that has spread. It is administrated in three weekly cycles and contains Herceptin and Emtansine. My understanding is that you must have already had herceptin and (paclitaxel or docetaxel) before it is offered . My question is could this  wonder drug be used to replace the "taxels" before secondaries have occurred or is it a question of finance.? I'm due to start my Herceptin paclitaxel on the 1st August. Thanks every one. Deirdre
Posts.Title: New Drug for HER2+ive called KADCYLA

Posts.Content: I had a mastectomy with lymph removal ten days ago. When the district nurse was changing the dressing yesterday she said i had on oedema and it needed to be drained. I went to "emergency" yesterday and the doctor said it needed to be the size of a grapefruit before draining as it could cause an infection. The swelling is not in my arm pit it is in the breast area. It looks like a breast is re growing......i wish. It is also blue ish. I asked the doctor if it was a hematoma or oedema and he said both.I have an appointment with my oncologist on Tuesday but my question is what do i do until then.......ice? heat? rest? excercise? I'm very anxious, thank you.
Posts.Title: odema or hematoma after masectomy?

Posts.Content: Thank you every one. My doctor called in yesterday and agreed not to drain it yet. She said while it is soft it is better to leave it and hopefully it will disolve itself. I;m seeing my sergeon on Tuesday for the results of the operation and a plan for the start of chemo. I think im getting a valve inserted in my neck on Friday 5th. I dont know if this will be delayed if i still have the seroma. I also got my breast cancer marker blood test results back today. It looks as if i am back in the normal zone.  I am delighted with this news but am i being too optimistic, can these markers get worse again? Thanks Optimum
Posts.Title: odema or hematoma after masectomy?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, i posted a few days ago about a burning blister. I'm now thinking it maybe shingles, has anyone had this with Chemo? I had a terrible nerve pain in my calf 8 days ago which moved to my thigh. The hospital did an ultrasound before i started my first Taxol to make sure it wasn;t a DVT. The nerve pain is now into day 8 and spreads between my ankle and thigh. I have a few more blisters around my knee. I'm due to have my pre chemo blood tests tomorrow morning will this show a virus in my system?  Thanks Deirdre
Posts.Title: Shingles?

Posts.Content: Hi Lin, i have 6 more herceptin injjections to go. My body is aching all over. My muscles and joints feel like i am about 90. I stopped excercising as i thought this was the problem but it has made no difference. I feel everything contracting after 15 mins sitting. I started "arimidex" 4 weeks ago so i think this may be making it worse. Herceptin is more important than arimidex so i think i may cut the later out until my injections have finished. Its hard, as everyone thinks once the chemo and readiotherapy are over then the problem has gone.......wrong, (for me any way) .I'm self employed so luckily i can work around it. Deirdre x
Posts.Title: Herceptin, anyone else feel yucky for 4-5 days

Posts.Content: Thanks Lin, i live in France and unfortunatly  can't get to a "moving forward " course. I was 5/14 with one "extra capsular extension" but i am ER - ive.  I have also had a hysterectomy so no ovaries to produce estrogen. My understanding is that anastrozole  suppresses estrogoen but i guess our bodies produce it in other ways, My oncologist suggested i could have a break form the arimidex. I was thinking of stopping until i finish my herceptin in July and then starting again.  Deirdre x
Posts.Title: Herceptin, anyone else feel yucky for 4-5 days

Posts.Content: Hang in there its worth it. Deirdre
Posts.Title: Herceptin, anyone else feel yucky for 4-5 days

Posts.Content: Thanks for the replys everyone. I ve just had it confirmed as shingles. I'm on Aciclovir 5 times a day for 10 days and my chemo is cancelled for tomorrow. I m lucky it wan't last week as i had my first Herceptin and would hate to have that delayed! So i think i'll have a glass of wine and enjoy having a  chemo free week . Deirdre
Posts.Title: Shingles?

Posts.Content: Hi, i had a mastectomy on the 10th April and developed a seroma 10 days later.(the morning of my first chemo) I had it unsuccessfully drained on the 10th May and again yesterday. They drained 120 ml and i think there is still some in there. I live in France so there is no Macmillan or breast cancer nurse to ask. I've looked at a few blogs here, some people say to compress it, some say to ice it and somewhere i read it said to," not continue with excerices"( i also have cording in my arm so i'm doing a lot of arm excercises) Any advice please? Thanks Deirdre
Posts.Title: Seroma advice please

Posts.Content: I am having physio for my "cording" and i am going to ask the physio about lymphatic drainage. In the mean time i've started wearing a bra by day (my wound was open so i was trying to let the air at the tissue). I hope you have a smooth landing!!!
Posts.Title: Seroma advice please

Posts.Content: Thanks, .........I'll start massaging my "aeronautical" as well......at least its given us a laugh!! Deirdre
Posts.Title: Seroma advice please

Posts.Content: HI everyone. I am 6 months into herceptin injections and i am having terrible muscle pain. I thought it was coming from the chemo but i finished that 3 months ago and the discomfort is getting worse. If i rest for more than 15 mins i struggle to move. It also happens during the night when i try to move in bed. It feels like i have done very strenuous excercise. If this is normal at least i know i have only 6 months more to go. Has any one else experienced this? Thanks Deirdre
Posts.Title: Herceptin and muscle pain

Posts.Content: Thanks Jane, the oncologist just shrugged and said to take anti inflamatories. I guess i am worried that it is a second cancer to its good to know others have had this. On a positive side i am half way through it, i finish in July, so i can put up with it as i know it should be keeping the "c" at bay. Thank you  Deirdre
Posts.Title: Herceptin and muscle pain

Posts.Content: HI Shey, are you having your herceptin every 3 weeks? Its not just my legs, its my arms and hands. Everything stiffens up after not moving for 15 mins.....it seems to be accumulative. I first started noticing the aches 3 months ago at the end of chemo, but then it was after an hour of rest ie after resting in the afternoon. hay ho.....if it is herceptin causing it , then its a little price to pay. I also got a crusty nose during chemo and i started using an ointment at night which seemed to take the dryness away. The joys!!!! Deirdre x
Posts.Title: Herceptin and muscle pain

Posts.Content: Hi everyone.I ve had a mastectomy and finished my 4 big chemo sessions. I'm due to start taxol and herceptin on the 1st August and radiotherapy around november. Emotionally i'm coping and certainly on the surface everyone thinks i'm fine, but now and again i get totally overwhelmed with fear. I constantly fell like there is a dark cloud sitting on my shoulder. Has any one any suggestions for books to read on "coping mechanisms"? Thank you Deirdre
Posts.Title: Books on anxiety and Fear please

Posts.Content: Thank you Jane, i will look into all of these. Deirdre
Posts.Title: Books on anxiety and Fear please

Posts.Content: HI, i had a mastectomy in April 2017 but was not given the choice of reconstruction at the time. I think it was because i needed radiotherapy after 6 months of chemo. I presumed at the time i would have reconstruction. 14 months later all my treatment is finished and i feel great, however i can not face another 6 hour operation. I have got used to the silicone prothesis which just sits in the little slot in my bras. ( the same as "chicken filets" peolple use to enhance their size) I wish i could have had the reconstruction at time,  Hope this helps Deirdre
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Choices....Any Thoughts?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, i've finished 6 months of Chemo and 14 sessions of radiotherapy.....i've only 11 sessions left. Everything has happened so quickly that i have not allowed myself to think. I had a mastectomy on the 10th April and when i had my meeting after i was told they had removed 14 nodes, 5 were infected and one was "ruptured". I am living in France and the "rupture" translates to "extra capsular extension". I think the word "rupture" is now playing on my mind as i am getting close to the end of my treatment. All i can think is that the lymph node has burst and the contents (with cancer cells) have spilt out into my body. Has any one else had this? and can anyone tell me "not to worry it doesn't matter" Thank you Deirdre
Posts.Title: Extra capsular extension?

Posts.Content: Thanks Lin, i ve been able to put it to the back of my mind for 7 months and now it seems to be getting to me. How long ago was yours? Deirdre
Posts.Title: Extra capsular extension?

Posts.Content: Hi Ann, i live in france and had a mastectomy on the 10th April my first ec was on the 9th May. here they encourage you to continue with all sports where ever possible as it eliminates the toxins quicker.  I'm relatively fit but not a runner. I have been doing either one hour of power walking a day or half an hour on the static bike.I had my second chemo tuesday week ago and all went well. The first few days are a bit rough and after that each day i have improved. I'm now looking forward to 9 relatively "normal' days. I have always felt better after the excercise. The statistics here are also showing a 50% less chance of reoccurance if you excercise. KEEP RUNNING and enjoy it. Deirdre x
Posts.Title: Any runners here?

Posts.Content: HI Jbelle I posted two days ago about anxiety and fear and i received a very useful reply from "Skyeis" with a few options. The reply is to my question "books on anxiety and fear" Like you and the others who have posted, i keep getting overwhelming feelings of fear and anxiety. One of my infected lymph nodes is "extra capsular" which means it has burst and i cant help thinking it has travelled everywhere or somewhere. I'm normally a positive person and most people think i am taking this in my stride. Sometimes i am ok but i constantly have a "dark cloud" hanging over me. Exercise is helping me. I live in France and they have interesting statistics on  cancer reocurrance and exercise. Its called MET....metobolic equivalent task. There is a 50% less chance of reoccurance if you follow the minimum suggestions.  There is a list of 30 sports. I have chosen walking at 5km per hour, and i get 3 points for each walk. (you get more points if you do 6.5km per hour) The aim is to do 9 points in the week i e 3 x 5 kms walks in an hour per week. I always feel better after the walk but having just finished my 4th EC i havent been very disciplined in the past 2 weeks.!!! I start weekly Taxol and herceptin on the first of August so im sure the routine of this will motivate me. Deirdre
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: Yes swimming is on the list. Its worth 6 i.e. double my walking.  They recommend minimum 3 times a week, so to looking at the list you should try to do a minimum of 3 half hour sessions a week.Hope this helps. The statistics are based on research since 2009.  Deirdre x
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: Yes swimming is on the list. Its worth 6 i.e. double my walking.  They recommend minimum 3 times a week, so to looking at the list you should try to do a minimum of 3 half hour sessions a week.Hope this helps. The statistics are based on research since 2009.  Deirdre x
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: Can you tell me how to contact for the course please?
Posts.Title: HOPE COURSE !

Posts.Content: Belfast please
Posts.Title: HOPE COURSE !

Posts.Content: Hi all, our credit card covers holiday cancellations. I finish my radiotherapy at the beginning of January 2018 but i will be on herceptin until July 2018. Does any one know when "we" are classed as healthy again....ie not a risk to the insurance company.  Its great to be thinking of possibly going on holiday again! Thank you Deirdre
Posts.Title: Credit card holiday insurance

Posts.Content: Thanks very much Jo but unfortunatly/fortunatly we live in France, so i don't think Boots will cover that. I think i will have to bite the bullet and phone our credit card company. I know that airlines like easy jet offer flight insurance but i don't know if we have to declare existing conditions.Thank you any way Deirdre
Posts.Title: Credit card holiday insurance

Posts.Content: Could i also ask how a mammogram is done after a mastectomy and no reconstruction?
Posts.Title: Mama gram after mastectomy
